intro: Orophea rugosa, commonly known as the rough orophea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Cyclanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, palm-like leaves and showy, yellow-orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually rough to the touch, hence the species name "rugosa," and it thrives in humid, tropical environments. Orophea rugosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in shaded conditions.
